content.description: That girl is outside the kwiky mart.  Baller finger stemming past bulges to locker laybacking.  Was she watching?
content.protection: 2x Subtips to fingers. 1x big fingers to hands.
content.location: The left nice looking right facing corner.

content.description: Why would you say that, that’s fucked up?  Yeah well…  Steep face climbing with micro widget pro. Post sport climbing at its finest. If you hate yourself continue up the garbage pail finale to the Empty Casket anchor. If your name isn’t Randy Ropedrag and you have runners, cut right to Hands Down, its much less junky.
content.protection: Tiny microcams and nuts, fingers, 2x hands. Runners. Self confidence.
content.location: Just left of Hands Down, the steep seam. The coolest looking thing around.

content.description: How do you get elected mayor of a trash pile like this? Give the people what they want.  What do the people want? Steep Cro-mag pockets with rock bottom pricing.  Every idiot wants to get their picture taken with this guy.
content.location: Loner Wall, left side, just before the wall ends.

content.description: Real sport climbing for the masses. Positive arête grappling action with a grip of pockets.  A gem in a junkyard.
content.location: The first route you will see on the Loner Wall. Faces east.

content.description: Stinky slot burping on the way to the car door handle store.  Two rounds of bottom shelf grandpa fists for everyone, on the house.
content.protection: 1x tips, fingers to hands. 2x Big hands and Fists. Draw.
content.location: Behind the tree, fugly left facing corner.

content.description: Stop huffing glue and get hooked on crack.  Clean thin hands to romper hands and fingers.
Fun hero finger corner to trash can stemming.  Stay heads up as the budget rock ruins the sweet features, don't fill the casket.
content.protection: 2x tips to finger, 1x thin hands to hands.
content.location: Nice looking right facing corner. Just left of Nuke the Whales.

content.description: Hillbilly roof leads to all star finger corner. Pocket of the year contest when you get bored.  Almost as good as the Mace. Back clean below the roof or punch yourself in the head.
content.protection: 2x sub tips and tips, 1x fingers, 2x thin hands. Small nuts. Draws.
content.location: Loner Wall, on the left as the wall starts to go uphill.

content.description: Mini splitter corner  below a mighty chockstone.  Hot step right to bolted gym holds. More fun than going to a water park with your cousins.
content.location: First route you will come across as you hike up.

content.description: Funk fingers with an intro to trash pockets into an awkward arête and rooftop face climbing.
content.location: Start with the other cuzin but move left after 10 feet.

content.description: Busted asymmetric twin cracks to gape worthy arête dancing.  Don’t forget your selfie stick.
content.protection: 1x fingers to hand and a fist. Draws.
content.location: Left end of the main area. Obvious OW to arête.

content.description: This would make John Burcham proud.  Mantle a tombstone into a minefield of pockets.  Fun arete partying that doesn’t ask you to buy gas.
content.protection: 9 Draws. 2x tips/small finger at the start.
content.location: Loner Wall. At the lowest point of the wall.

content.description: Ghost Town is a mini crag tucked away in the folds of the San Francisco Peaks that features crisp cracks and uniquely featured sport climbs. The setting in the Schultz burn area means that the views steal the show. Wild flowers abound in summer, adding to the scenic ambiance. The cliff is at an elevation of 9200 feet and faces SW, so expect lots of sun, cloudy days are ideal. During monsoons, there is no shelter from rains, but the rock dries very quickly. However, the approach is long, the lines are short and the Tuff rock makes me think that the Oak Creek Overlook had a one night stand with Sedona choss. These factors combine to make a scrappy crag that will appeal to those who appreciate beautiful settings, loath crowded crags, and perfect rock isn’t a requirement to enjoying climbing. Enjoy, or not. Whatever.
